title: Reduction of dinitrogen to ammonium through a magnesium-based electrochemical process at close-to-ambient temperature
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, Advance Article
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE01090F, Communication
Melinda Krebsz, Rebecca Y. Hodgetts, Sam Johnston, Cuong K. Nguyen, Yvonne Hora, Douglas R. MacFarlane, Alexandr N. Simonov
While direct nitridation of magnesium requires high temperatures, we demonstrate that an electrodeposited, magnesium metal surface can activate N2 at close-to-ambient temperature, and the resulting material can be converted into ammonium.
